title: [Large-Scale] Data-Driven Approaches for Alloy Design and Performance Prediction

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational materials science, basic metallurgy concepts, and introductory statistical analysis
context.additional_context: Optimizing time during work via smartphone-based mobile learning, with practical project-based assessments.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of alloy performance prediction models using Density Functional Theory (DFT) and machine learning
Learners can analyze the correlation between alloy components and chemical short-range order (CSRO) and apply it to performance prediction data
Learners can simulate the process of building an alloy composition-performance database using a data management system

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
